info.title: Azure IoT Hub Portal API
info.description: Available APIs for managing devices from Azure IoT Hub.

enable.description: A value indicating whether the channel is enabled.

isConnected.description: `true` if this instance is connected; otherwise, `false`.

isEnabled.description: `true` if this instance is enabled; otherwise, `false`.

dateCreation.description: The IoT Edge configuration creation date.

conditions.description: The IoT Edge configuration target conditions.

metricsTargeted.description: The IoT Edge configuration targeted metrics.

metricsApplied.description: The IoT Edge configuration applied metrics.

metricsSuccess.description: The IoT Edge configuration success metrics.

metricsFailure.description: The IoT Edge configuration failure metrics.

creationDate.description: The IoT Edge configuration creation date.

metricsTargeted.description: The IoT Edge configuration targeted metrics.

metricsApplied.description: The IoT Edge configuration applied metrics.

metricsSuccess.description: The IoT Edge configuration success metrics.

metricsFailure.description: The IoT Edge configuration failure metrics.

creationDate.description: The IoT Edge configuration creation date.

tags.description: The device tags targeted by the configuration.

authenticationMode.description: The authentication mode (either SymmetricKey or Certificate)

isConnected.description: `true` if this instance is connected; otherwise, `false`.

isEnabled.description: `true` if this instance is enabled; otherwise, `false`.

tags.description: List of custom device tags and their values.

isLoraWan.description: `true` if this instance is lorawan; otherwise, `false`.

isConnected.description: A value indicating whether the device is currently connected.

isEnabled.description: A value indicating whether the device is enabled on the platform.

supportLoRaFeatures.description: A value indicating whether the LoRa features is supported on this model.

hasLoRaTelemetry.description: A value indicating whether the device has telemetry.

statusUpdatedTime.description: The device last status updated time.

confirmed.description: A value indicating if the command must be confirmed by sensor

isBuiltin.description: A value indicating whether this instance is builtin.
A value indicating whether this instance is builtin.

supportLoRaFeatures.description: A value indicating whether the LoRa features is supported on this model.

isWritable.description:
Indicates whether the property is writable from the portal
> Note: if writable, the property is set to the desired properties of the device twin
>       otherwise, the property is read from the reported properties.
Default is false.

Indicates whether the property is writable from the portal
> Note: if writable, the property is set to the desired properties of the device twin
>       otherwise, the property is read from the reported properties.
Default is false.

name.description: The registered name in the device twin.

label.description: The label shown to the user.

required.description:
Whether the field is required when creating a new device or not.
Default is false.

searchable.description:
Whether the field can be searcheable via the device search panel or not.
Default is false.

scope.description: The IoT Edge scope tag value.

nbDevices.description: The number of connected devices on IoT Edge device.

nbModules.description: The number of modules on IoT Edge device.

tags.description: List of custom device tags and their values.

isEnabled.description: `true` if this instance is enabled; otherwise, `false`.

nbDevices.description: The number of devices connected on the IoT Edge.

name.description: The IoT Edge device model name.
The IoT Edge device model name.

id.description: The module name, only used for AWS IoT Greengrass.

name.description: The module identity twin setting name

value.description: The module identity twin setting value

The route value.
Eg : FROM /messages/* INTO $upstream.

classType.description:
The LoRa device class.
Default is A.

preferredWindow.description:
Allows setting the device preferred receive window (RX1 or RX2).
The default preferred receive window is 1.

deduplication.description:
Allows controlling the handling of duplicate messages received by multiple gateways.
The default is Drop.

rX1DROffset.description:
Allows setting an offset between received Datarate and retransmit datarate as specified in the LoRa Specifiations.
Valid for OTAA devices.
If an invalid value is provided the network server will use default value 0.

rX2DataRate.description:
Allows setting a custom Datarate for second receive windows.
Valid for OTAA devices.
If an invalid value is provided the network server will use default value 0 (DR0).

rxDelay.description: Allows setting a custom wait time between receiving and transmission as specified in the specification.

abpRelaxMode.description:
Allows to disable the relax mode when using ABP.
By default relaxed mode is enabled.

fCntUpStart.description:
Allows to explicitly specify a frame counter up start value.
If the device joins, this value will be used to validate the first frame and initialize the server state for the device.
Default is 0.

fCntDownStart.description:
Allows to explicitly specify a frame counter down start value.
Default is 0.

fCntResetCounter.description:
Allows to reset the frame counters to the FCntUpStart/FCntDownStart values respectively.
Default is 0.

supports32BitFCnt.description: Allow the usage of 32bit counters on your device.

keepAliveTimeout.description:
Allows defining a sliding expiration to the connection between the leaf device and IoT/Edge Hub.
The default is none, which causes the connection to not be dropped.

isConnected.description: `true` if this instance is connected; otherwise, `false`.

isEnabled.description: `true` if this instance is enabled; otherwise, `false`.

tags.description: List of custom device tags and their values.

useOTAA.description: A value indicating whether the device uses OTAA to authenticate to LoRaWAN Network, otherwise ABP

devAddr.description:
Unique identifier that allows
the device to be recognized.

alreadyLoggedInOnce.description: A value indicating whether the device has already joined the platform.

dataRate.description:
The Device Current Datarate,
This value will be only reported if you are using Adaptive Data Rate.

txPower.description:
The Device Current Transmit Power,
This value will be only reported if you are using Adaptive Data Rate.

nbRep.description:
The Device Current repetition when transmitting.
E.g. if set to two, the device will transmit twice his upstream messages.
This value will be only reported if you are using Adaptive Data Rate.

downlink.description: A value indicating whether the downlinks are enabled (True if not provided)

classType.description:
The LoRa device class.
Default is A.

preferredWindow.description:
Allows setting the device preferred receive window (RX1 or RX2).
The default preferred receive window is 1.

deduplication.description:
Allows controlling the handling of duplicate messages received by multiple gateways.
The default is Drop.

rX1DROffset.description:
Allows setting an offset between received Datarate and retransmit datarate as specified in the LoRa Specifiations.
Valid for OTAA devices.
If an invalid value is provided the network server will use default value 0.

rX2DataRate.description:
Allows setting a custom Datarate for second receive windows.
Valid for OTAA devices.
If an invalid value is provided the network server will use default value 0 (DR0).

rxDelay.description: Allows setting a custom wait time between receiving and transmission as specified in the specification.

abpRelaxMode.description:
Allows to disable the relax mode when using ABP.
By default relaxed mode is enabled.

fCntUpStart.description:
Allows to explicitly specify a frame counter up start value.
If the device joins, this value will be used to validate the first frame and initialize the server state for the device.
Default is 0.

fCntDownStart.description:
Allows to explicitly specify a frame counter down start value.
Default is 0.

fCntResetCounter.description:
Allows to reset the frame counters to the FCntUpStart/FCntDownStart values respectively.
Default is 0.

supports32BitFCnt.description: Allow the usage of 32bit counters on your device.

keepAliveTimeout.description:
Allows defining a sliding expiration to the connection between the leaf device and IoT/Edge Hub.
The default is none, which causes the connection to not be dropped.

isBuiltin.description: A value indicating whether this instance is builtin.

supportLoRaFeatures.description: A value indicating whether the LoRa features is supported on this model.

useOTAA.description:
A value indicating whether the device uses OTAA to authenticate to LoRaWAN network. Otherwise ABP.
Default is true.

downlink.description:
Allows disabling the downstream (cloud to device) for a device.
By default downstream messages are enabled.

isLoRaSupported.description: A value indicating whether the LoRa features are acticated.

Bearer.description:
Specify the authorization token got from your IDP as a header.
    > Ex: ``Authorization: Bearer * ***``
